result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kaitlin R Weiss

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kaitlin R Weiss in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.  Not deemed a high enough risk for drug court  change of plea:  CF- Plea Ct. 1-Uttering  DRI Ct. 2 and CM file  recommend probation.  If successfully completes probation expungement may be requested.
BTC:  P-G found G  JOC entered  PSI ordered  Restitution will not be disputed  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kaitlin R Weiss in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Defendant is being considered for Drug Court.
Pre-Trial Conference and Order/case adjourned off the record.
Pre-Trial Conference and Order/case adjourned off the record.
Status conference on April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 2, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Kaitlin R Weiss in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Kaitlin R Weiss in custody.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
